body:
Introduction To SkillUp

SkillUp is a skills development solution for internal upskilling and internal mobility. Individuals identify current skills proficiency and are provided a learning plan for skill development for their existing role or a future role. Skill development is verified through successful completion of skill assessments and role certifications. For the organization, SkillUp provides a skills inventory of the developer org to identify strengths, gaps, and inform workforce planning.

SkillUp Use Cases

By creating visibility into your developer talent's current and future state, SkillUp helps create value for your organization and your developers by enabling data-driven development. 

Here is how it works: 

For Employers:

  • Workforce Planning: Gain insights into your organization's distribution of skills and roles. This data-driven approach allows you to understand your workforce's strengths and gaps, driving the success of your upskilling initiatives.
  • Talent Assessment: Accurately assess the current skill levels of your technical workforce using SkillUp's data-driven approach, eliminating guesswork and assumptions for informed decision-making.
  • Learning and Development Tracking: Utilize comprehensive reporting and analytics tools to track the progress and effectiveness of your learning and development initiatives. Monitor the impact of your efforts and make data-driven decisions for continuous improvement.
  • Internal Mobility: Facilitate internal career paths and job moves for your technical talent by identifying potential candidates based on their verified skill profiles and development progress. This feature can reduce attrition and promote career advancement opportunities within your organization.

For Developers:

  • Upskilling Resources: Access a vast library of learning materials, including courses, tutorials, and hands-on projects, to enhance your skills across various roles and technologies. These resources are tailored to help you upskill and continuously benchmark your proficiencies.
  • Verified Skill Profiles: Create and maintain a verified skill profile on SkillUp. This profile showcases your proficiencies, achievements, and technical expertise, providing a comprehensive overview of your skills.
  • Curated Learning Resources : Based on your current skill level, career goals, and your organization's needs, SkillUp can recommend customized learning paths. These paths ensure efficient and targeted skill development, aligning your growth with organizational requirements.

By leveraging SkillUp, developers can take control of their skill development, earn credentials, and explore internal mobility opportunities. Simultaneously, employers can make informed decisions about their technical talent, drive upskilling initiatives, and ensure a skilled and productive workforce aligned with business objectives.

Accessing Employer Platform

This portal is designed for employers to access all the skill-level data in their organization in one place. 

Log in to your HackerRank account, click on Hire from the top menu, and select SkillUp from the dropdown menu.   

The Employer side of the SkillUp platform has two pages: 

Overview

Here, you can see a graphical representation of your organization's certified roles and skills.  

Main components: 

  • Company Overview: This graph gives you a clear view of your developer's funnel. It tracks the number of developers onboarded, assessed, and certified on the platform.
  • Certificate Distribution: This graph breaks down the distribution of the certified employees in each certification.
  • Certification Trends: This graph provides the trend of certifications over a period of time. You can filter by choosing certifications and timelines. 
  • Skill Distribution: This graph provides the skill level distribution of experts, intermediates, and beginners in each skill. You can filter by all skills or the skills you want by using the skills filter provided in the top right corner of the dashboard.

Talent

The talent directory organizes every developer in your organization based on their Designation, Certifications, and Skills proficiency. It helps you identify the individuals who best match a particular skill you seek. 

  • You can use the filters placed at the top to filter the employees based on their Job titles, certifications, skills, and managers.  
  • You can export this data by clicking the Export List button.
  • You can select any employee from the list and send them invitations for the certification or a skill badge test.

User Management

The User Management section on the employer platform allows you to access all the users in your organization from one place. 

  • To access the User Management page, click the profile icon and select the User Management option.  
  • You can now access all the users in your organization along with the filtering options.
  • To add a user, click on Add New Users.  
  • There are two types of users, Individual and Organization. Select the desired license you want to provide the user and click Send Invite.
  • You can also download the user data in bulk using the download option. 

Accessing Employee Platform  

The employee platform is segregated into three tabs: 

Home

On the home page, you can see two sections: 

My Career

This section shows you the certificates you have earned and tracks your progress toward your next certification goal. To view each role's certificate and progress details, utilize the slider component to scroll through them. Monitoring this section empowers you to take ownership of your learning path.

Assigned to Me

This section shows the additional certifications your leadership team suggested for you. Utilize this tailored guidance to open up new skills-development opportunities aligned with organizational needs. Tracking these recommendations allows you to see areas where growing your capabilities can stretch your impact.

  

Skills Directory

This directory enables you to explore in-demand skills to acquire. You can view globally trending abilities and all the skills available in HackerRank's library, organized by categories such as AI & ML, Software Engineering, Cloud Engineering, Data Engineering, and more. Tracking skills here provide visibility into those that align with organizational needs and can grow your impact.

As you select skills of interest, you can choose the proficiency level you want to target among Beginner, Intermediate, and Expert. You can access the concepts covered in the recommended learning resources. 

Practice Assessment

  • To test your skills, you can use the Practice Assessments. These untimed tests provide a safe environment to hone your coding skills without consequences. Only you can access the results of these assessments. 
  • There is no limit to these assessments; you can keep practicing until you are sure about taking an actual assessment .
  • In your practice assessments, you'll have access to an AI Tutor Bot in the form of a Socratic tutor. This assistant is designed to help you learn and understand new skills as you work through real-world coding challenges. The AI assistant can:
    • Explain the problem statement and requirements
    • Debug your code and point out errors or inefficiencies
    • Suggest alternative solutions or approaches
    • Answer questions and guide the way 

Earning Proficiency Badge

You can take the skill proficiency assessment once you are ready to assess your skill. These assessments help you evaluate your expertise in a specific area. 

Select the proficiency level and click on the Earn Badge. This will take you to the test environment.  

Roles Directory

This directory empowers you to explore organizational roles that match your skills. View roles organized by category where you can earn certifications based on your capabilities. Assess your readiness for each role while understanding the required skills and certification details. Tracking this directory provides visibility into areas where focused development can strengthen your impact and eligibility for new responsibilities over time. 

You can click on the desired role to look for the required skill proficiency. The graph at the bottom of the page compares your current and required skill levels to help you understand the areas to focus on. If you have all the necessary skills for a role, you can take the certification test and add it to your profile. 

Earning Certification

Role certification assessments lead to professional credentials certified by SkillUp, validating your knowledge and competency in a particular role. Earning these certifications showcases your readiness for specific job roles and responsibilities. When you have all the prerequisites unlocked you can take the assessment by clicking on the Take the Certification button. 

Once you have earned the certification it will show up on your profile with the date you earned it. 

My Profile

Your profile is the equivalent of a resume, where you can write your bio and provide your social links such as LinkedIn, Github, Stack Overflow, Twitter, or a personal website. The certifications you have completed and skill badges you have attained will appear here.  

To access your profile, click on the name in the top right corner and select My Profile.  

Frequently Asked Questions

How is a proficiency level determined?

Skill Ratings determine the proficiency level. HackerRank determines the cut-offs for each proficiency in a skill-based on inputs from SMEs and how the top 10% of the employees have scored in a particular assessment that determines the skill proficiency.

In the case of custom assessments (tailored to meet organization's requirements), the organizations set the cut-offs.

What if I take multiple assessments that assess the same skill?

The Skill Rating would be based on the results from the most recent assessment taken. This will help us keep the Skill Rating accurate and up-to-date to enable your decision-making process.

 

How can I access past Skill Ratings?

In the profile of an employee, you can go to the Skill Details section to see the progress of Skill Ratings over a period of time.

 

How many retakes are allowed for an assessment?

The employer will determine the number of retakes for each assessment based on their policies.

The cool-down period is determined as the days to pass before taking the next retake. 

 

What is the difference between Skill Ratings and Badges?

Skill Rating is a quantitative indicator of an individual's proficiency in technical skills.

Badges, on the other hand, are a way of acknowledging an achievement or a skill acquisition at a skill proficiency level. You can receive a badge when you have taken an assessment and reached proficiency level.

For example, If you take a Java assessment and achieve the required Skill Rating for expert proficiency, you will receive the Java (Expert) ^ badge.

 

What happens to my skill rating if the assessment is retired or updated?

An assessment is considered retired if it is deleted from HRW. You will continue to see the assessment scores in the Assessment History, but your Skill Rating will reflect the most recent Rating before the retired assessment.

An assessment is considered updated if the content of the assessment is changed. Your Skill Rating will not be affected if an assessment is updated.

 

How can I add custom learning resources to SkillUp?

You must provide an Excel sheet with the links to custom learning resources like Pluralsight videos or Udacity courses. Within two business days, the HackerRank team will manually add these links to the relevant skills. In the future, you can add custom resources through the admin dashboard.

 

Can I influence the content in certification assessments? 

No, you cannot influence or customize the content in the certification assessments. Hackerrank is taking a strategic bet on AI-first learning and will invest in providing guided, immersive AI tutors for each skill and role. The certification content will be Hackerrank's proprietary AI-powered assessments.

 

What is the difference between a badge and a certification? 

A badge is earned for demonstrating proficiency in a skill after passing a skill assessment. Certification is earned for a role that combines multiple skills after passing a comprehensive role assessment that includes prerequisites of earning the relevant skill badges.

 

Can I transfer skill badges earned outside the company (e.g., on the HackerRank community) to my employer's SkillUp account?

Currently, you cannot transfer external skill badges into your organization's SkillUp account. SkillUp treats personal community certifications separately from professional employer certifications to maintain data privacy and boundaries.

 

How often are the global in-demand skills updated on the SkillUp platform?

The global in-demand skills showcased on SkillUp are updated annually based on HackerRank's skills report research. However, the company is exploring increasing the frequency of these updates.
title: HackerRank SkillUp
